meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6852.

td.p: Peter Dyakowski, a professional football player from Hamilton, Ontario, Canada
Sarah Fremgen, a microbiologist from Carrollton, Texas
Brian Loughnane, an investment operations manager from Scituate, Massachusetts (whose 1-day cash winnings total $22,600)

tr.td: FOUNDERS DAY
FIRE PLACE
NICE "RUG"
WORD PROBLEM PROBLEMS
TV DRAMA SERIES
ALASKA'S GLACIERS

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_6_1', 'clue_J_6_1_stuck', '(Sarah of the Clue Crew comes to us from a boat near Margerie Glacier in Alaska.) The shorelines were completely covered by ice just 200 years ago; today\'s glaciers in Glacier Bay are remnants of the "LIA", or Little this, which started in the early 14th century.')

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_6_2', 'clue_J_6_2_stuck', '(Sarah of the Clue Crew talks to us from a boat in Glacier Bay, Alaska.) This famous Baltimore medical school sponsored early expeditions to Glacier Bay, which is why there\'s a glacier and an inlet that share their name with the philanthropist the University is named for.')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Sarah of the Clue Crew talks to us from a boat in Glacier Bay, Alaska.) This famous Baltimore medical school sponsored early expeditions to Glacier Bay, which is why there's a glacier and an inlet that share their name with the philanthropist the University is named for.
